intro: Tanacetum falconeri, commonly known as Falconer's tansy, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk, typical of the family, and has aromatic, often mint-scented foliage. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to rocky, alpine soils. Tanacetum falconeri is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used traditionally in some regions for its medicinal properties.
